CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 15, 1958, pg. 2, reads: "Does This Condition Exist in Other Neighborhoods? Liquor Control Board Should Exercise Better Judgment - One of the overlooked evils in some neighborhoods of Allegheny County is the location of taverns in close proximity to churches, schools and playgrounds. Although such establishments do not operate on Sundays, their presence and the conduct of some patrons prove annoying during the week....  Central Baptist Church...three doors up from tavern on Kirkpatrick St."
TitMainTitle: Intersection with Golden Bar on corner, Central Baptist Church on right, and Chauncey Wilson Pharmacy in distance, 500 Kirkpatrick Street and Centre Avenue, Hill District
